discussion.content:
Hi guys,
I think the logic sequence is like this:
Task-1
SW-1
conf t
interface e0/1
switchport mode access
switchport access vlan 10
switchport voice vlan 11
no shut
end
wr

Task-2
SW-2
conf t
interface e0/1
switchport mode access
switchport access vlan 30
no shu 
end
wr

Task-3
SW-1
conf t
vlan 10
name Engineering
end
wr

Task-4
Sw-1
conf t
interface e0/0
lldp transmit
lldp receive
no cdp enable
end
wr

SW-2
conf t
interface e0/0
lldp riceved
lldp transmit
no cdp enable
end
wr

Task-5
SW-1
interface e0/2
no cdp enable
end
wr

Task1
SW-1
interface ethernet0/1
switchport mode access
switchport voice vlan 11
switchport access vlan 10
wr

Task2
SW-2
Interface ethernet0/1
switchport mode access
switchport access vlan 30
wr

Task3
SW-1
vlan 10
name Enginnering
wr

Task4
SW-1
lldp run
interface ethernet0/0
lldp transmit
lldp receive
wr
Sw-2
lldp run
interface ethernet0/0
lldp transmit
lldp receive
wr

Task5
Sw-1
cdp run
interface ethernet0/2
no cdp enable
wr

Task 1:
SW-1(Config)#int e0/1
SW-1(Config-if)#switchport mode access
SW-1(Config-if)#switchport access vlan 10
SW-1(Config-if)#switchport voice vlan 11
write memory

Task 2:
SW-2(Config)#int e0/1
SW-2(Config-if)#switchport mode access
SW-2(Config-if)#switchport access vlan 30
write memory

Task 3:
SW-1(Config)#int vlan 10
SW-1(Config-vlan)#name Engineering
write memory

Task 4 and 5
SW-1(Config)#lddp run
SW-1(Config)#int e0/0
SW-1(Config-if-range)lldp receive
SW-1(Config-if-range)lldp transmit
SW-1(Config)#int e0/2
write memory
SW-1(Config-if-range)#no cdp enable
SW-2(Config)#lddp run
SW-2(Config)#int e0/0
SW-2(Config-if-range)lldp receive
SW-2(Config-if-range)lldp transmit
write memory

1. Configure SW-1 switch port 0/1 to carry traffic for the Cisco IP phone and PC
2. Configure SW-2 E0/1 to carry traffic for PC2
3. Configure VLAN 10 with the name “Engineering” on SW-1
4. Configure the link between SW-1 and SW-2 to use the vendor neutral neighbor discovery protocol
5. Configure the link on SW-1 to R1 so that it does not allow the Cisco neighbor discovery protocol to pass
Task 1:
SW-1(Config)#int e0/1
SW-1(Config-if)#switchport mode access
SW-1(Config-if)#switchport access vlan 10
SW-1(Config-if)#switchport voice vlan 11

Task 2:
SW-2(Config)#int e0/1
SW-2(Config-if)#switchport mode access
SW-2(Config-if)#switchport access vlan 30

Task 3:
SW-1(Config)#int vlan 10
SW-1(Config-vlan)#name Engineering

Task 4:
SW-1(Config)#lddp run
SW-1(Config)#int range e0/1-2
SW-1(Config-if-range)#no lldp transmit
SW-1(Config-if-range)#no lldp receive
SW-2(Config)#lddp run
SW-2(Config)#int e0/1
SW-2(Config-if)#no lldp transmit
SW-2(Config-if)#no lldp receive

Task 5:
SW-1(Config)# int e0/1
Sw-1(Config-if)#no cdp enable

write memory

Man, i think that you need review this question.

4. Configure the link between SW-1 and SW-2 to use the vendor neutral neighbor discovery protocol
I think in task 5 you should also enable the transmit and receive command for LLDP on the 0/0 interfaces between SW1 and SW2.
not true because when you enable "lldp run" globally it activates lldp on all interfaces.

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-

//IMG//


R1 has been pre-configured with all the necessary commands. All physical cabling is in place and verified. Connectivity to the end devices must be configured.

1. Configure SW-1 switch port 0/1 to carry traffic for the Cisco IP phone and PC
2. Configure SW-2 E0/1 to carry traffic for PC2
3. Configure VLAN 10 with the name “Engineering” on SW-1
4. Configure the link between SW-1 and SW-2 to use the vendor neutral neighbor discovery protocol
5. Configure the link on SW-1 to R1 so that it does not allow the Cisco neighbor discovery protocol to pass
How is noise defined in Wi-Fi?

choices.C: signals from other Wi-Fi networks that interfere with the local signal
choices.D: ratio of signal-to-noise rating supplied by the wireless device
choices.A: measured difference between the desired Wi-Fi signal and an interfering Wi-Fi signal
choices.B: any interference that is not Wi-Fi traffic that degrades the desired signal

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Answer is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The IPv6 address for the LAN segment on router R2 must be configured using the EUI-64 format. When configured which ipv6 address is produced by the router?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct the only one with FF.FE

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: A
A. floods unknown destinations to all ports except the receiving port

In a switched Ethernet network, when a switch receives a frame with an unknown destination MAC address (one that is not in its MAC address table), it will “flood” the frame. This means the switch will send the frame out of all ports except the one on which it was received. This flooding behavior allows the frame to reach its intended destination if the device is connected to one of the other ports. Once the destination device responds, the switch learns the MAC address and port association, adding it to its MAC address table to avoid flooding future frames destined for that MAC address.

incorrect Options: B. Switches do not drop frames from unknown destinations; they flood them.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text: What is a characteristics of frame switching?

choices.B: inspects and drops frames from unknown destinations
choices.C: forwards frames to a neighbor port using CDP
choices.D: protects against denial of service attacks
choices.A: floods unknown destinations to all ports except the receiving port

Task1
Sw-1
vlan 77
name User_VLAN
vlan 177
name Voice_VLAN
wr
Sw-2
vlan 77
name User_VLAN
vlan 177
name Voice_VLAN
wr

Task2
Sw-1
interface range ethernet0/1-3
switchport mode access
switchport access vlan 77
switchport voice vlan 177
wr

Sw-2
interface range ethernet0/1-3
switchport mode access
switchport access vlan 77
switchport voice vlan 177
wr

Task3
Sw-1
lldp run
interface ethernet0/0
lldp transmit
lldp receive
wr 
Sw-2

interface ethernet0/0
lldp transmit
lldp receive

Task 1:
Sw1(Config)#vlan 77
Sw1(Config-vlan)#name User_VLAN
Sw1(Config)#vlan 177
Sw1(Config-vlan)#name Voice_VLAN
Sw2(Config)#vlan 77
Sw2(Config-vlan)#name User_VLAN
Sw2(Config)#vlan 177
Sw2(Config-vlan)#name Voice_VLAN

Task 2:
Sw1(Config)#int range e0/1-3
Sw1(Config-if-range)#switchport mode access
Sw1(Config-if-range)#switchport access vlan 77
Sw1(Config-if-range)# switchport voice vlan 177
Sw2(Config)#int range e0/1-3
Sw2(Config-if-range)#switchport mode access
Sw2(Config-if-range)#switchport access vlan 77
Sw2(Config-if-range)# switchport voice vlan 177

Task 3:
Sw1(Config)#lldp run
Sw1(Config)#int range e0/1 - 3
Sw1(Config)#no lldp transmit
Sw1(Config)#no lldp receive
wr mem

Sw2(Config)#lldp run
Sw2(Config)#int range e0/1 - 3
Sw2(Config)#no lldp transmit
Sw2(Config)#no lldp receive
write memory

comments.content:
no lldp transmit / receive you input that command in the interface mode not global configuration (config-if) . but here we are asked to make it up for interface e0/0 
so i would add 
interface e0/0 
lldp transmit
lldp receive 
apply this on both switches .
you are correct about lldp automatically deploying trans receiv on all ports when activated, however, i wonder if it is necessary to deny them on other ports since this is not stated in the question

No by default it's in transmit and receive as soon as you do lldp run, however he should disable transmit and receive on all the other interfaces as the task didn't mention the other ports but only e0/0
Sw1(Config)#lldp run
Sw1(Config)#int range e0/1 - 3
Sw1(Config)#no lldp transmit
Sw1(Config)#no lldp receive

Sw2(Config)#lldp run
Sw2(Config)#int range e0/1 - 3
Sw2(Config)#no lldp transmit
Sw2(Config)#no lldp receive
add lldp transmit receive command on interface level on both sides

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-


Guidelines
-

This is a lab item in which tasks will be performed on virtual devices

• Refer to the Tasks tab to view the tasks for this lab item.
• Refer to the Topology tab to access the device console(s) and perform the tasks.
• Console access is available for all required devices by clicking the device icon or using the tab(s) above the console window.
• All necessary preconfigurations have been applied.
• Do not change the enable password or hostname for any device.
• Save your configurations to NVRAM before moving to the next item.
• Click Next at the bottom of the screen to submit this lab and move to the next question.
• When Next is clicked the lab closes and cannot be reopened.


Topology
-

//IMG//



Tasks
-

All physical cabling is in place and verified. Connectivity for the Switches on ports E0/1, E0/2, and E0/3 must be configured and available for voice and data capabilities.

1. Configure Sw1 and Sw2 with both VLANS, naming them according to the VLAN Name provided in the topology.
2. Configure the E0/1, E0/2, and E0/3 ports on both switches for both VLANS and ensure that Cisco IP phones and PCs pass traffic.
3. Configure Sw1 and Sw2 to allow neighbor discovery via the vendor-neutral protocol on e0/0.
